Swipe down to generate names. To generate new names again you have to eventually scroll to the top and then swipe down again.

 Check the right boxes to save your favourites. 

 The bottom bar can be used to set how many unique names should be generated on one swipe.
Syllables can only contain lowercase, unaccented, alphabetic characters
Syllables must be at least two characters long
Syllables must contain at least one vowel
Must at least contain one pattern in curly braces {}
Must have the same amount of opening { and closing } curly braces
Pattern must start with one of these characters: X/x (any), C/c (consonant), V/v (vowel)
Pattern length must be at least 1 and max. 9
Pattern range must be at least 1-1 and max.9-9
You have no active syllables. Please activate or create some.
You have no active patterns. Please activate or create some.
You only have active patterns which require consonants but no active syllables that start with one.
You only have active patterns which require vowels but no active syllables that start with one.

Edit the patterns used for name generation.
Edit the syllables used for name generation.
He translated the app into portuguese and has some cool projects too! Have a look: https://github.com/adrielcafe

To add a new name, syllable or pattern just click on the \"+\" button in the bottom right corner of the lists.\n\n
To show the edit and delete buttons of a name, syllable or pattern simply swipe from right to left on the desired entry. This will hide the \"+\" button, so to show it again swipe from left to right on the entry.

Patterns can contain fixed items but must always contain at least one syllable-part.

 A syllable-part has to start with a "{" and end with a "}".

 The first character of it must be either "X", "C" or "V". This determines if the first syllable should start with a consonant (C), a vowel (V) or if it can be random (X). Setting this character to lowercase or uppercase also sets the first character of the starting syllable to lowercase or uppercase.

 Then follows the amount of used syllables. Either set a fixed number between "1" and "9" or set a range between "1-1" to "9-9".

 Outside of these syllable parts, you can add anything you like and it will be added to the generated parts.




To understand the previous text a bit better, I will explain what the patterns provided at installation will do.


"{X2-9}" will generate names starting with an uppercase random syllable and these names will contain between 2 and 9 syllables.


"{V1} {C1}'{c1-4}" will generate names starting with one uppercase syllable that has a vowel as first character.
 Then follows a static blank space.
 Then one uppercase syllable that starts with a consonant will follow, directly followed by a static apostrophe.
 The last syllable-part will add a lowercase consonant syllable and will contain between 1 and 4 syllables in total.

To add a new name just click on the \"+\" button in the bottom right corner.\n\n To show the edit and delete buttons of a name swipe from right to left on the entry. This will hide the \"+\" button, so to show it again swipe from left to right on the entry

To add a new syllable just click on the \"+\" button in the bottom right corner.\n\n To show the edit and delete buttons of a syllable swipe from right to left on the entry. This will hide the \"+\" button, so to show it again swipe from left to right on the entry

To add a new pattern just click on the \"+\" button in the bottom right corner.\n\n To show the edit and delete buttons of a pattern swipe from right to left on the entry. This will hide the \"+\" button, so to show it again swipe from left to right on the entry
